name: Puccini's Tosca : the hystorical and art locations where a timeless heart breaking drama took place
description: Puccini's Tosca was performed in the most  amazing  Roman locations : it opens in the beautiful 16th century Church of Sant' Andrea della Valle at noon, where Cavaradossi is painting a portrait of a young lady ; it moves to the Farnese Palace that evening itself when Tosca dramatically killed the lustful Scarpia and finally to the battlements of the Castel Sant'Angelo, at dawn, the following day, where the final drama is played out.
